oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Andrew Johnson
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Born in 1808 in Raleigh, North Carolina, Andrew Johnson moved to Greeneville, Tennessee in 1826. Johnson held the following offices during his lifetime: Tennessee State Legislator, 1835-1837; Tennessee State Senator, 1841-1843; U.S. Congressman, 1843-1853; Governor of Tennessee, 1853-1857; U.S. Senator, 1857-1862, 1874-1875; Military Governor of Tennessee, 1862-1865; Vice President of the United States, 1865; and President of the United States, 1865-1869. Johnson died in 1875.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Men; Legislators; Presidents; Governors
